medical_history.chief_complaint: Fever with chills, malaise, fatigue, cough, and vomiting
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began 2 days prior to clinic visit (January 11, 2001) following return from Africa on January 6. Patient had a fever of 39°C (102°F) at the clinic. Symptoms persisted despite treatment, and on January 14, the patient collapsed and was subsequently transported to the hospital.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Previous malaria chemoprophylaxis with chloroquine; no chronic illnesses or surgeries specified.
medical_history.family_history: Mother also took chloroquine for chemoprophylaxis; no other relevant family history specified.
medical_history.social_history: Patient born in Nigeria and emigrated to the US in 1991; returned to Nigeria for 3 weeks prior to symptoms.
